description: Energy monitoring dashboard comparing Kepler Dev, Node Exporter, and Kepler Latest metrics for system-wide, process-level, and container-level energy consumption analysis.

panels.description: Overall dashboard explanation and information about the metrics being collected

options.content:
## 🔋 Energy Monitoring Dashboard

This dashboard provides comparative metrics from multiple energy monitoring solutions:

| Source | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| **🚀 Kepler Dev** | Development build of Kepler from current code base |
| **🔥 Node Exporter** | Hardware-level monitoring via Prometheus node exporter |
| **⚡ Kepler Latest** | Latest build of Kepler from the main branch |

Use the dashboard variables to select:
- RAPL zone (package, core, dram)
- Monitoring job
- Process to analyze

panels.description: CPU information from the Kepler monitoring tool
panels.title: CPU Information

targets.expr: kepler_build_info{job="${job}"}

panels.description: Build information for Node Exporter monitoring tool

targets.expr: node_exporter_build_info

panels.title: Node Exporter Build Information

targets.expr: kepler_build_info{job="kepler-latest"}

panels.description: Current values of energy metrics from different sources
panels.title: Current Energy Consumption Values

panels.description: Difference between Node exporter and Kepler Dev energy measurements in watts. Values close to zero indicate good alignment between the metrics.
panels.title: Node Exporter vs Kepler (Δ J/s)

panels.description: Difference between Node exporter and Kepler energy measurements in watts. Values close to zero indicate good alignment between the metrics.
panels.title: Node Exporter vs Kepler Measurement Delta (Watts)

panels.description: Direct comparison of energy measurements from all three monitoring systems - Node Exporter, Kepler Dev, and Kepler Latest
panels.title: Node Energy Comparison (J/s)

panels.description: Process-level energy monitoring with selected PID: ${pid} (${process})

options.content:
## 📊 Process Energy Monitoring

Comparing process-level metrics between Kepler Dev and Kepler Latest for the selected process.

Key metrics shown:
- Attribution gap between node and process measurements
- Direct power consumption comparisons between monitoring systems
- Joules and Watts measurements from different sources

panels.description: Energy difference between node-level and process-level measurements
panels.title: Process Energy Attribution Gap

panels.description: Difference between node-level and process-level energy over time
panels.title: Node - Process Energy Attribution Gap

panels.description: Energy consumption comparison for selected process (${process})

targets.expr: scaph_process_power_consumption_microwatts{pid="$pid"} / 10^6

panels.title: Process Energy Comparison - ${process}

options.content:
## 📊 Container Energy Monitoring

This section shows container-level energy metrics from Kepler Dev and Kepler Latest.

Metrics shown:
- Energy attribution gap between process and container measurements
- Power consumption comparisons across monitoring systems
- Container power attribution accuracy

panels.description: Energy difference between process-level and container-level measurements
panels.title: Container Energy Attribution Gap

panels.description: Difference between process-level and container-level energy over time
panels.title: Process-Container Energy Attribution Gap

panels.description: Percentage of energy measured at node level that is not attributed to specific processes
panels.title: Kepler Dev - Process Energy Attribution Gap (%)

panels.description: Percentage of energy measured at node level that is not attributed to specific processes
panels.title: Kepler Latest - Process Energy Attribution Gap (%)

title: Kepler Energy Monitoring Dashboard
